author: Laurence Fletcher
title: Cuba Could Offer Hope for Investors in Iran
text: International companies and investors hoping that the U.S.’s exit from the Iran nuclear deal won’t scupper their own chances of investing in the Islamic Republic could take heart from the example of Cuba in the 1990s. In 1996, after two U.S. civilian planes were shot down by the Cuban military, the U.S. adopted the so-called Sorry, This Oil Route Is Closed Due to a Collapse in the Iran Deal—Energy Journal Next Consumer Inflation Pressures Are Still Modest
